info.senderName: NWS Corpus Christi (Corpus Cristi, Victoria and Laredo)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued March 30 at 3:34AM CDT until March 30 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS Corpus Christi
info.description: ...Critical Fire Danger Conditions Today Across South Texas... .Very dry air mass will move into south Texas today behind a frontal boundary. West-northwest winds will increase by 9 AM with gusts between 35 and 40 mph expected through the day. Temperatures will warm into the upper 80s to lower 90s with relative humidity values falling to 8 percent over the Brush Country to 10-15 percent over the inland Coastal Plains. Critical fire danger conditions are expected from mid morning until early evening when wind speeds will diminish. Near extreme fire danger conditions are possible over the western Brush Country where wind gusts will be the highest along with the lowest humidity. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM THIS MORNING TO 8 PM CDT THIS EVENING FOR STRONG WINDS AND VERY LOW HUMIDITY FOR ALL OF SOUTH TEXAS... * TIMING...From 10 AM until 8 PM Wednesday * WIND...West-northwest winds 20 to 25 mph with gusts from 35 to 40 mph. * HUMIDITY...Around 8 percent Brush Country, 10-15 percent inland coastal plains, and 20-30 percent islands. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now....or will shortly. A combination of strong winds...low relative humidity...and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior. Residents are urged to exercise care with respect to all outdoor activities that could inadvertently cause wildfires. Report wildfires quickly to the nearest fire department or law enforcement office.
